title: Spies of Ancient Rome
description: A quick win: understand Spies of Ancient Rome.

hook.text: Rome didn't have a spy agencyâ€”until it did. The frumentarii started as grain collectors and became secret police.

buildup.text: These grain supply officers traveled the empire freely. Their access made them perfect intelligence gatherers.

discovery.text: Emperor Hadrian formalized them into a spy network that reported directly to himâ€”bypassing the Senate entirely.

twist.text: The frumentarii became so feared and hated that Emperor Diocletian dissolved them. He replaced them with a new unit.

climax.text: Rome proved a pattern repeated through history: intelligence agencies grow until they threaten their own masters.

punchline.text: Rome's grain inspectors became its most feared spies.

quiz.question: What was the original role of the frumentarii before becoming spies?
